chargeHist.descr: Invade Privacy - Use Surveillance Device (Victim < 18 years old)
Capture an Intimate Representation  (Victim < 18 years old)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler J Lustig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Invasion Of Privacy-Surveillance Device (Victim Under Age 18), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.08(2)(a).
  • Attempt Attempt Capture An Intimate Representation Without Consent (Victim Under Age 18), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with count 2.  Credit for 72 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
No new law violations.
No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 18 unless approved by agent.
No contact with A.G.B. and family unless approved by the agent.
No contact with firearms.

Cooperate with agent.
Sex offender evaluation and follow through with recommendations.
Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications and follow through with recommendation.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
Pay supervision fees.
Obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling or combination of both.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
All mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges including DNA surcharge and assessments.  To be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Any cash bail to apply.
-Restitution set at $0.00.

Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

*Court does not order the defendant to register as a sex offender.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler J Lustig

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tyler J Lustig in court, in custody.  Attorney Daniel G. Mitchell in court for Tyler J Lustig.  Attorney Kenneth Olstinski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant. Statement made by Rachel Lustig, the defendants step-mother. 

AS TO COUNT ONE; The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 42 MONTHS, concurrent to COUNT 2, with credit for 72 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 18 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT TWO; The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 36 MONTHS, concurrent to COUNT 1, with credit for 72 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 18 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- No new law violations. 
- Cooperate with agent. 
- Sex offender evaluation and follow through with recommendations.
- No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 18 unless approved by agent.
- Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications and follow through with recommendation.
- Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
- No contact with AGB and family unless approved by the agent.
- Obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling or combination of both.
- No contact with firearms.
-Provide DNA Sample.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Restitution set at $0.00.
- All mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges (including DNA surcharge) and assessments to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Any cash bail to apply.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. 

Court does NOT order the defendant to register as a sex offender.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed. Defense Letters of Support
Received and Filed. Defense Letters of Support
Received and Filed. Defense Letters of Support

Defendant Tyler J Lustig in court with attorney Daniel G. Mitchell.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tyler J Lustig appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court finds the State has complied with Victim/Witness Notification. 
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.    Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, body armor,ammunition and/or explosives.   Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Br 45.  Defendant Remanded.  mn  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defense Letter of Support, Filed.
All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room 502 SB

Defendant Tyler J Lustig in court with attorney Daniel G. Mitchell.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tyler J Lustig appeared by video means with Attorney.  Zoom appearances.  Adjourned to allow continued treatment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tyler J Lustig in court with attorney Daniel G. Mitchell.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense recently retained and has not received discovery and an offer. Defense requests more time to review case.  Case remains calendared in Branch 34.  Status conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 08:30 am by zoom.

Defendant Tyler J Lustig in court with attorney Daniel G. Mitchell.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Cases mistabbed to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Case reassigned to Homicide Sexual Assault Court. Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Yamahiro, Br. 34. Case adjourned to Branch 34.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyler J Lustig in court with Attorney Daniel G. Mitchell.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defense Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, Filed

Adjustment Number: 22A 015464,

Amount: $20.00

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Defendant ordered to not be in possession of any recording devices.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AJB, any children under the age of 18, and Cudahy Middle School.

Defendant Tyler J Lustig in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Defendant advises the court that he has hired privtae counsel but his attorney could not appear at today's initial appearance.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/7/22 @ 1p
